ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: It was solely the live virtual lecture.
The class discussion was the only mode of learning.
Met five times a week online

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Learned a lot about czech culture and language.
I had no prior knowledge of the Czech language, so I was able to quickly learn various aspects of grammar and syntax.
I learned basic Czech grammar, vocabulary, and how to have basic conversations.
I gained an understanding of the czech language as well as basic communication and reading skills in czech.
This course covered all the basics of Czech grammar, including the case system and three verb tenses. By the end of the semester, we could write, read, and speak simple sentences.
I learned a language that is completely new to me.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Really enjoyed the teacher
This course was a lot of fun and provided a comfortable environment for anyone and everyone to learn the language. There were no weak points at all.
This course is not built for Zoom. The only way I could see it being more helpful would be for it to be in person.
I think this course was well set up and I enjoyed the lectures of professor von Kunes. I think. the system of breakout rooms to work collaboratively also aided in my understanding of the language.

The strengths of this course are Professor von Kuness infectious positive attitude and the breadth of the Czech language we covered. The weaknesses included the lack of energy from other students in the class and the limited vocabulary that we covered.
I think there are only strengths. It was taught very well especially over zoom.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The live lectures were all-encompassing and allowed for a high level of engagement in the course, itself.

Outside of class participation in readings and practice, it was difficult to learn and stay engaged. There was homework, but the submission was confusing and often did not work, and the instructions on the homework were often vague.
I think the course did pretty well to adapt to covid although it would have been more beneficial to be in person.
Daily classes worked well! Most people didnt have their camera on and didnt participate, but I dont know how it could have been more engaging to other students.
I think they all succeeded. Zoom turned out to be great with this class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Definitely would recommend. Teacher moves at a good pace and makes sure you learn the material.

I would highly recommend this course to another student if you are attempting to find a new language to learn that is outside of your comfort zone. Czech with Dr. Von Kunes provides a comfortable, yet intellectually challenging learning environment for anyone to succeed.

Yes, I think czech is an interesting language and the layout of the class was well suited for student learning and was a collaborative environment. I also thought I enjoyed this class the most and my experiences were the most friendly of all my classes.

Yes, definitely! This class is such a fun opportunity to learn a foreign language. If you are interested in Slavic cultures or just need to fulfill your language requirement, I cannot recommend this course higher.
Absolutely. This course is great to take.
